name: Rick Owens: Footwear
proof: Wearing a uniform, breaking the monotony; the ethos of Rick Owens is one that can be applied to almost every path in life. Throwing yourself at your goals, over and over. Build. Build. Build.

name: The Stranger
proof: One of the most interesting novels I've had the pleasure of reading. Camus balances the extreme and mundane moments we behold in or lives. It made me think of the dangers of the pitfalls of absurdist thinking. Life has no inherent meaning, but that does not mean you should not ascribe it one.

name: Curb Your Enthusiasm
proof: Larry David is a genius, being the anti-hero we all wish we could be in day to day life. I enjoy that this show feels surreal in certain sense, as so many of the situations seem implausible. Should you tell someone they're being a sample greedy at Baskin Robbins? Let's find out.

name: Francis Bacon
proof: Visceral, guttural, ethereal. One of the greatest painters of the 20th century. Art with meaning. Exploring the atrocities of the greater world as well as individual struggles, and harnessing these feelings into something tangible.

name: Disintegration Loops
proof: Born from tragedy, Basinski captures feelings of solace and creates soundtrack that elicits feelings of hope. I formed an attachment to this album while hiking up Mt Wilson. It is one's duty to carry on.

name: The Holdovers
proof: This film made me reflect on the importance of leading with compassion. In some aspect of life, we have all drawn a stick shorter than most. We all need compassion. Everyday you choose to be whatever you want. Why not choose to be nice?

name: Margiela: Tabi
proof: Maison Margiela takes advantage of texture to tell a story like no other fashion house. They explore the fringe possiblities of garment construction in a way that is playful yet bold.

name: Aphex Twin
proof: Aphex Twin is a true display of what it means to be a master of your craft. The breadth of his catalogue shows his ability to create timeless work, with an aesthetic that permeates pop culture to this day.

name: The Bear
proof: The Bear encapsulates the intensity of working in a high stakes fast paced  kitchen environment. It deals with themes of sacrifice and impostor syndrome that are inherent to elevating ones craft. This is a show I love to watch with others or on my own.

name: The Hellp: Vol 1
proof: Bruce Springsteen meets The Strokes. Country meets Indie Sleaze. The Hellp breathes new life into a scene that is on the rise again, reminding us to define your path and goals. The lyrics are introspective and emotional, and bring me to a place where I am forced to reflect on who I am.

name: Banh Mi My Tho
proof: I love bringing my friends and family here. I really appreciate when you can notice care put into certain recipes and preparation. The texture of the baguette, the flavors in the meat and pate, and the crispness of the vegetables make this one of the best sandwiches around.

name: Vans Authentic
proof: I never expected this shoe to become the basis for my everyday uniform. These shoes serve me in a practical sense; I've taken them on countless walks, and on multiple vacations. I love what they represent. The Californian connotation, the punk roots.
